channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2901] X-Wing Fighter Accident in 1942 [Pic]
[+2140] Who really spends the most on their armed forces? (Graphic)
[+2070] Worst Playground Location Ever (PIC)
item.description: Spotted on a church in Rhinebeck, NY. Photos by bcurrie.

item.title: [+1918] Prostitution and its working girls [Graphic]
item.description: For the same price as a most items on the McDonald's Dollar menu, you can purchase a prostitute in some parts of the world! Getting what you pay for? You be the judge!

item.title: [+1666] Post-Palin Alaska has largest debt burden in US
item.description: When the former vice presidential candidate resigned as governor of Alaska in the summer of 2009, she left the state with a 70 percent debt-to-GDP ratio -- the highest state debt burden in the United States.

item.title: [+1514] Zero Punctuation : Final Fantasy XIII
item.description: This week, Zero Punctuation reviews Final Fantasy XIII.

item.title: [+1348] Could This Be The Dumbest Government Politician Ever?
item.description: Fast forward the video to 1:20. You won't believe your eyes or ears.

item.title: [+1166] Court Says Bush Illegally Wiretapped Two Americans
item.description: A federal judge on Wednesday said the George W. Bush administration illegally eavesdropped on the telephone conversations of two American lawyers

item.title: [+1105] Apple iPad [Review]
item.description: Combine basic-but-essential work tools with iWork, an improved browser, e-mail, iPod, and photo applications, a well-executed e-Book platform with iBooks, and throw in thousands of downloadable apps and games, and package it all in a gorgeous, slim slate with a beautiful 9.7-inch touch screen, you have yourself a winner.

item.title: [+1042] 90 percent of Windows 7 flaws fixed by removing admin rights
item.description: 90 percent of the vulnerabilities in Windows 7 are mitigated by configuring users to operate without administrator rights.

item.title: [+966] Your April Fools' Day Prank Spoiler
item.description: A few of the obligatory April Fools' Day pranks tech firms will roll out today will be funny. Some will be believable. To confirm the jokes, and help you avoid endless "Did you see this" emails, we're rounding them up here.

item.title: [+918] NBC announces nationwide "Tonight Show with Jay Leno" tour
item.description: Just when you thought NBC couldn't stoop any lower...

item.title: [+876] Diggbar and Super Mario (Is this April Fool?) - [Image]
item.description: Just saw a SuperMario running on my digg toolbar. Is this for April Fool??

item.title: [+830] Copyright Troll Loses High-Stakes Unix Battle
item.description: A Salt Lake City jury on Tuesday ruled against SCO Group's claim it owned the copyright to the Unix operating system, a cousin to the popular open-source OS

item.title: [+721] The Scoop on Semen (Infographic)
item.description: Everything you'll ever need to know about the male jungle juice.

item.title: [+720] Congressman thinks Guam will tip-over and capsize
item.description: Congressman Hank Johnson articulates his fear about the island of Guam becoming so “overly populated that it would actually tip-over and capsize." It gets really good at the 1:25 mark.

item.title: [+704] Flowchart: How You'll Inevitably Shatter Your iPad
item.description: The iPad has a 9.7-inch glass screen. As for when it will slip from your hand and slam face-first into the hard, unrelenting floor or sidewalk, such is only a matter of time. Flowcharts, you see, never lie.

item.title: [+677] How Do You See Your Colleagues? [PIC]
item.description: If you’re convinced that the office would devolve into mayhem without your team’s contributions, you’re not alone–in thinking you’re the most important, that is.

item.title: [+673] Afghanistan, March, 2010 [PICS]
item.description: In Kandahar, the birthplace of the Taliban, American forces are pushing forward, aiming to break the Taliban's hold on the city and southern Afghanistan. The number of foreign troops under US and NATO command is set to rise to 150,000 by August, with most of the new deployment heading to the south.

item.title: [+626] 10 Meanest Tricks That Games Ever Played on Us (SPOILERS)
item.description: This April Fools’ Day, we look back with a sick mixture of irritation and awe at the pranks played on us by the friends we least suspected: our videogames.Big, big spoilers follow!
